intro: Patellocalamus patellaris, commonly known as the Patellaris grass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or open woodlands. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny florets, typical of many grass species. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant plant in its native habitat.
